meanings.definition: To make a harsh, grating noise
meanings.sent1: The old door would gnarr loudly whenever it was opened.
meanings.sent2: The rusty gate started to gnarr as it swung back and forth.
meanings.sent3: The gnarr of the car engine sounded like a tired monster waking up.
meanings.sent4: The gnarr of the gears grinding together was a symphony of mechanical discord.
meanings.sent5: The gnarr of the chalk on the blackboard made everyone cringe.

meanings.sent1: The gnarr of the chainsaw echoed through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The old building was filled with the constant gnarr of metal scraping against metal.
meanings.sent3: The gnarr of the rusty swing set made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The gnarr of the brakes screeching made everyone jump in surprise.
meanings.sent5: The gnarr of the old piano keys created a haunting melody.

meanings.sent1: He would gnarr about the weather every morning.
meanings.sent2: She tends to gnarr whenever things don't go her way.
meanings.sent3: The cat would gnarr at the empty food bowl, demanding to be fed.
meanings.sent4: The toddler started to gnarr when his toy was taken away.
meanings.sent5: The students would gnarr about the upcoming exam.

meanings.sent1: Her constant gnarr about the office temperature was getting on everyone's nerves.
meanings.sent2: The customer's gnarr about the service was heard by the manager.
meanings.sent3: His gnarr about the long line at the store was met with understanding.
meanings.sent4: The child's gnarr about the broccoli on his plate was ignored by his parents.
meanings.sent5: The employee's gnarr about the new policy was noted by the supervisor.
